clinical_study.brief_title: Genotype/Phenotype Correlation of Movement Disorders and Other Neurological Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: Genotype/Phenotype Correlation of Movement Disorders and Other Neurological Diseases

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NINDS)

clinical_study.source: National Institutes of Health Clinical Center (CC)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this protocol is to identify families with inherited neurologic conditions, especially movement disorders, to evaluate affected and unaffected individuals clinically, and to obtain blood samples for genetic analysis.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this protocol is to identify families with inherited neurologic conditions, especially movement disorders, to evaluate affected and unaffected individuals clinically, and to obtain blood samples for genetic analysis.

criteria.textblock:
Neurologic disease or movement disorders affecting 2 or more family members.
No conditions in which phlebotomy is contra-indicated.
